alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Harris; Heard; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:35AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Carroll, Heard, Troup, western Coweta and northwestern Harris Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 334 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Newell to near La Fayette, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, pea sized hail, frequent lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... LaGrange, Carrollton, Hamilton, Franklin, West Point, Hogansville, Grantville, Bowdon, Pine Mountain, Whitesburg, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Corinth, Plant Yates, Mountville, Cannonville, Louise, Seaton Lake and Dunaway Gardens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
